newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end lower across the board.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end lower across the board.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended lower on Friday, as book squaring, ahead of the spot contract's expiry on July 25, capped the topside, traders said.
Prices ranged from 1.0 to 2.0 yen lower, with benchmark December ending down 1.6 yen at 112.8 yen per kg.
Spot July fell steadily from the opening, due to book squaring by local investors, traders said.
"Other contracts fell in line with spot July. We think the bearish mood will remain in the market until next Friday," a brokerage house trader said.
